intro: Withania schottiana, commonly known as the Indian winter cherry, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and potatoes, and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into red, berry-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features include yellow stamens and a superior ovary, typical of the Solanaceae family. Withania schottiana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
